messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Just curious
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/3/02 5:06:21 PM Central Daylight Time, ... In Kansas, we have to file, one time, a form (short) declaring ourselves a nonaccredited
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/3/02 5:06:21 PM Central Daylight Time,
mummyone24@... writes:


> I live in FL and we have a thing called 600 schools that are listed as
> private but can encompass the right to homeschool as well. That way we can
> get out of testing and evaluations and sending in a NOI. Does any of the
> other states have such a thing?
>
> Mary B (who likes the rules down here!)

In Kansas, we have to file, one time, a form (short) declaring ourselves a
nonaccredited private school. No testing, no evaluations, no notices of
intents... Lovely little thing. I don't even have to give the kids name,
rank, or serial numbers. <g>
~Nancy (who also likes the rules here!)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Just curious
messages.msgSnippet: I was just wondering about the whole evaluation testing thing. I live in FL and we have a thing called 600 schools that are listed as private but can encompass
messages.messageBody:
I was just wondering about the whole evaluation testing thing.

I live in FL and we have a thing called 600 schools that are listed as
private but can encompass the right to homeschool as well. That way we can
get out of testing and evaluations and sending in a NOI. Does any of the
other states have such a thing?

Mary B (who likes the rules down here!)
